contentrichtext.text: :''For other uses see [[You Light Up My Life]]'' {{Infobox film | name = You Light Up My Life | image = You light up my life poster.jpg | caption = Theatrical poster | director = [[Joseph Brooks (songwriter)|Joseph Brooks]] | producer = Joseph Brooks | writer = Joseph Brooks | starring = [[Didi Conn]] <br /> [[Joe Silver]] <br /> [[Michael Zaslow]] | music = [[Joseph Brooks (songwriter)|Joseph Brooks]] | cinematography = [[Eric Saarinen]] | editing = [[Lynzee Klingman]] | distributor = [[Columbia Pictures]] | released = {{Film date|1977|8|31}} | runtime = 90 minutes | country = United States | language = English | budget = | gross = }} '''''You Light Up My Life''''' is a 1977 romantic [[comedy-drama film]] written and directed by [[Joseph Brooks (songwriter)|Joseph Brooks]].<ref name=imdb>{{IMDb title|0076941|You Light Up My Life}}</ref> The picture stars [[Didi Conn]], [[Stephen Nathan]] and [[Michael Zaslow]], and follows a girl named Laurie (Conn), who wants to be a singer. Soon, she finds herself pressed by young friends to sing and her father, who wants her to be a comic.<ref name=imdb/> The film was widely panned by critics, garnering a 20% fresh rating on [[Rotten Tomatoes]].<ref name=rottom>{{rotten-tomatoes|you_light_up_my_life|You Light Up My Life}}</ref> Some cited Didi Conn's sensitive portrayal and the title song as its most worthwhile features.<ref name=rottom/> == Title song == The film received the [[Academy Award for Best Original Song]] as well as the [[Grammy Award for Record of the Year]] for the title song "[[You Light Up My Life (song)|You Light Up My Life]]." The song was written by [[Joseph Brooks (songwriter)|Joseph Brooks]] and sung for the film's soundtrack by [[Kvitka Cisyk|Kvitka "Kasey" Cisyk]].<ref name=imdb/> The song was later recorded by [[Debby Boone]], and upon its release, it was #1 on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'s'' Hot 100 for a record-setting 10 consecutive weeks, making it the biggest hit of the 1970s. It earned Debby Boone a Grammy for Best New Artist. ==References== {{Reflist}} == External links == * {{IMDb title|0076941|You Light Up My Life}} * {{rotten-tomatoes|you_light_up_my_life|You Light Up My Life}} *[http://movies.yahoo.com/movie/1800137838/info You Light Up My Life at Yahoo.com] [[Category:1977 films]] [[Category:American films]] [[Category:English-language films]] [[Category:1970s comedy-drama films]] [[Category:1970s romantic comedy films]] [[Category:American comedy-drama films]] [[Category:Best Song Academy Award winners]] [[Category:Columbia Pictures films]] [[Category:Coming-of-age films]] {{Romantic-comedy-film-stub}} {{comedy-drama-film-stub}}
